On the other hand, choosing B guarantees a lower but still substantial reward of 40$.

Choosing R has an expected value of (number of times R beats B) * 35 + (number of ties) * 45, while choosing B has an expected value of (number of times B beats R) * 35 + (number of ties) * 40.

Since both choices carry some risk, I would lean towards the more secure choice with a higher guaranteed reward in most cases.
